授業目的:
This lecture introduces basics of international finance (or International Macroeconomics), and help students for understanding development mechanism of Asia-Pacific in this regard.
This lecture pursues for the dynamics of East Asia, appearing as one of main engines of the world economy. From the perspective of international macroeconomics and finance, we deal with developments before and after the 1997 Asian crisis.
到達目標:
・Students understand basics of international finance (or International Macroeconomics).
・Students understand the dynamics of East Asia.
・Students learn lessen from experience of Asian Currency Crisis.
授業方法: This course will be held on face-to-face.

トピック.授業計画1:
This course covers the following topics:
Part 1: Basics Concepts
(1) National Income Account
(2) The Balance of Payments Account
(3) Exchange Rates
(4) The Foreign Exchange Market
Part 2: Interest Parity Condition
Part 3: Real Money Demand and Supply
Part 4: PPP and Long Run Analysis
Part 5: Short Run Analysis
Part 6: International Monetary System
Part 7: Asia’s Economic Development and International Finance
トピック.授業外学習2:
Introductory economics is not a prerequisite of the lecture, but it will make it easier to understand. Nevertheless, the purpose of the lecture is not to convey only knowledge, but to motivate students to study further into the field.
Reality goes fast. Students are frequently reminded of important relevant news and reports from media and international institutions.

評価.教科書Required texts0: Krugman, Paul R., Maurice Obstfeld, and Marc J. Melitz, International Economics: Theory and Policy, 10th edition, Pearson, 2015.
